title: (x) BancSoft logo - Arial, Ex Ponto {Lex, Yves}
content:
The "Banc" is basically helvetica black oblique, but does anybody know what the "Soft" type is?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bancsoftlogoltr-bw.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110201225641/http:/typophile.com/files/bancsoftlogoltr-bw.jpg) | 6.55 KB |
author: popinfresh

comments.content:
"Banc" is actually Arial Black Italic - check out the angled terminals on the 'a' and 'c'. Don't know what "Soft" is though.

- Lex

"Soft" may be handwritten. Looks like a single stroke to cross the 'f' and 't'. You might like [Caflisch Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110201225641/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/caflisch_script_pro_ot/&sample_text=Soft&sample_size=74) or [Fineprint](http://web.archive.org/web/20110201225641/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/fineprint/&sample_text=Soft&sample_size=74).
